file_content.text: Republic military = suffered heavy casualties securing base
Love what they've done with the place. You could almost forget this was a Colicoid nest.
Would be better with Colicoids to hunt.
Perfectly good lab being neglected. Where's the zazz? I should have Holiday redesign this whole space.
Could the Republic have picked a creepier place to hang out? Keep expecting giant bugs to come out of the walls.
It's dark and dirty, but not the worst Republic base I've ever visited. Rodia still holds the title.
It's incredible to consider how long the Balmorrans have been carrying on this fight.
Soon, our allies will not cower in places like this. They will tread freely, with open sky above them and Imperial corpses below!
T7 sensors = detecting large Colicoid swarms nearby
I've got a bad feeling about this area. An installation that big shouldn't look so deserted.
Is Colicoid scent all over, Herald.
The Republic really needs to take better care of its facilities.
That control station looks important. Kind of surprised it's still intact.
Chatter on the comm frequencies says that tower got overrun by Colicoids.
Satellite control towers. These will be a priority target for the Imps to be sure.
Satellite control towers. Standard configuration. I'm surprised they're still in one piece.
Suspension bridges = destroyed by artillery // T7 + Jedi = within blast radius
Is there any place on Balmorra that hasn't been blown to smithereens?
Hmm. What prey will Scorekeeper send?
Why would people voluntarily live on this world?
Broken bridges are bad luck.
Looks like the Empire burned its bridges to keep us out. Not that it's doing any good.
The Imps really hit this area hard. Must've been something important here--probably just dust, now.
Yet more destruction wrought by our Imperial foes. They stop at nothing!
Sobrik = Imperial stronghold + highly dangerous
Sobrik. What it lacks in ambience, it makes up for in hospitality.
Empire even binds the sky.
Sobrik had a name for being quite the scenic spot once. Until the Empire made itself at home.
Sobrik isn't likely to appreciate us busting in, Captain. Then again, who is?
Imperials beware! Bowdaar comes for you!
Sobrik. The Empire will not give up this foothold on Balmorra easily.
Sobrik. The very heart of the Empire's hold on this world lies before us!
Troida Military Workshop = good place for droid parts?
This place used to crank out top-of-the-line weapons before the war.
Things are toys, for hunters without own skill.
Amateurish equipment. Now if I'd been working here, the Empire would--never mind.
Troida Military Workshop, huh? Bet they've got some first-class blasters laying around....
Boys and their toys... it's always the same--guns, gears and grit. Lucky for them, I like that sort of thing.
Advanced production facilities like this are a critical resource. Our forces need to take them and hold them.
When the Republic liberates Balmorra, these fine machines will contribute to the cause of liberty!
Dark spaces = favored by Imperials + insects
Let's put the Empire out of the prison business on Balmorra.
This is place for caging. Where points are lost.
My, the Empire has been busy.
I never get tired of busting people loose from Imperial prisons.
Building prisons must be the Empire's core competency. They seem to have one everywhere we go.
If we can free the prisoners here, the Balmorran resistance would be very grateful.
Freeing the prisoners here is our patriotic duty! Let none who stand for liberty suffer in bondage!
Imperial fortifications = deep + well-defended
Watch your step--that's a long drop down. Balmorra's apparently never heard of railings.
Empire has hidden well.
I suppose if you have a crater, you may as well make good use of it.
This place reminds Bowdaar of Kashyyyk.
Look at this Imperial base. What's the word I'm thinking of... oh, right: "deathtrap."
It doesn't look like the Imps have been holding this ground for long. If we push hard, we could probably smash right through.
Rather hasty fortifications on the Imperials' part. Certainly not up to regulations.
Battle zone = highly hazardous // Jedi = tread carefully
Know what Balmorra needs? More smoldering ruins. They don't have nearly enough.
Is still echoes of battle here. No good deaths.
I intercepted the odd Imperial broadcast, back on Nar Shaddaa. The Empire spun this carnage as a "glorious victory."
Of all the places we've been on Balmorra so far, this is the scariest. Wide open spaces are great places to get killed in a war zone.
You always take me to the nicest places. The destroyed walkers, crashed ships, smoking craters... it's all so rustic.
Such devastation. I don't know if Balmorra will ever recover.
This is only a taste of what the Empire is capable of. They must be stopped!
Imperial forward line = heavily fortified // Enemies = numerous
The Empire sure knows how to lay down a welcome mat. The turrets are a nice touch.
Balmorra will be scarred.
Crude and unnecessary--why use trenches when electrostatic strands work just as well?
This could get hairy real quick. The Empire's forward lines are no walk in the park.
Enemies are everywhere. Bowdaar will find them!
Fighting through trenches like these is never easy. We'd better take it slow and watch our backs.
Storm the trenches! Drive our enemies out like the vermin they are!
Balmorran Arms Factory = site of Republic defeat // Jedi + T7 = avenge the fallen!
And I thought Balmorra was rough on the outside. We'll be lucky to get out of here alive.
Hmph. Place is warren.
Don't look into that generator's light too long, Jedi. If these Balmorrans didn't build it with proper shields, say farewell to your retinas.
The Empire sure picked a nasty place to hole up in. On the other hand, there's bound to be sweet gear lying around....
This is a weapons factory, right? It occurs to me we might be slightly outgunned by the Empire....
Imperial defenses will be heavier here than anywhere else on Balmorra. We should be cautious.
Our enemy's final stronghold! We must press on until none are left standing!
Perplexity: This base appears to be repurposed from a Colicoid nest--or vice-versa.
Rumination: It is highly unusual to see intact satellite control towers in a war zone.
Revelation: That generator powers the entire droid factory. High-yield explosives would fix that.
Conclusion: Sobrik is home to many Imperial troublemakers, master. Let us delete them all!
Appreciation: Oh, master--you bring me to the nicest places. I may find useful upgrades here.
Criticism: I will never understand organics' compulsion to keep prisoners. Deletion is more efficient.
Assertion: An impressive fortification. To conquer it, one must delve to the very bottom.
Judgment: Most of the troublemakers here have already been deleted. How disappointing.
Query: I find trench warfare a refreshing change of pace, don't you?
Prediction: We will encounter maximum resistance from Imperial troublemakers here.
Approval: Some see a broken bridge, but I see a glorious deletion.
Conjecture: The lack of allied activity suggests a target-rich environment ahead. This warms my circuits.
